fields.label: Title for your application
fields.tooltip: Please enter the title in your primary language

fields.label: Subtitle for your application
fields.tooltip: Please enter the subtitle in your primary language

fields.label: Enter the url to your application logo (image should have equal height and width between 60px and 240px)
fields.tooltip: Make sure this is a publicly available url

fields.label: Enter the url you would like to direct users to when they click your logo
fields.tooltip: Make sure this is a publicly available url and is the full url

fields.label: Enter the url you would like to direct users to when they click About
fields.tooltip: Make sure this is a publicly available url and is the full url

fields.label: Enter the url you would like to direct users to when they click Download
fields.tooltip: Make sure this is a publicly available url and is the full url

fields.label: Enter a url to a valid Esri print service.
Enter a url to a map service to be used as a mask layer
fields.tooltip: This should cover all areas other then the area of interest

fields.label: Enter a semi-colon separated list of web app ID's(Map Themes) for other Forest Atlas applications.
fields.tooltip: These will be linked to from within your application under the Map Themes header.

fields.label: Enter a semi-colon separated list of names for the app ID's configured above(Map Themes).
fields.tooltip: These will be visible when you hover over map themes and take you to the app added above.
fields.placeholder: e.g. Forest Atlas of Cameroon;Forest Atlas of Equatorial Guinea

fields.label: Enter a narrative about your map to give your users some insight about it.
fields.tooltip: This will be visible in the table of contents.
fields.placeholder: Explore the Forest Atlas of Cameroon to discover ...

fields.label: Enter your Google Analytics tracking ID to enable trcking analytics of this application.
fields.tooltip: This will track events and pageviews
This will hide the header bar on the map
fields.label: Would you like to hide the header

fields.tooltip: This will hide the footer bar on the map
fields.label: Would you like to hide the footer

fields.tooltip: This will include the subscribe button in the info window and anlysis panel
fields.label: Would you like include an subscribe button

fields.tooltip: This will include the My GFW Login in the header
fields.label: Would you like include an My GFW Login

fields.tooltip: Would you like the navigation links to open in a new tab?
fields.label: By default they will open in the same tab.

fields.tooltip: Should be the language of the title/subtitle provided
fields.label: Choose a default language:

fields.tooltip: This will allow the application to toggle to an alternative language
fields.label: Would you like include an additional language

fields.tooltip: This should mirror the other webmap configured, but with services in the alternative language
fields.label: Enter an alternate Web Map Id, this will be activated when the language is changed in the app

fields.tooltip: The alternative language to use in your application
fields.label: Choose a second language:

fields.tooltip: Same title you configured earlier but in your alternative language
fields.label: Title for your application in the alternative language

fields.tooltip: Same subtitle you configured earlier but in your alternative language
fields.label: Subtitle for your application in the alternative language
Enter a semi-colon separated list of names for the app ID's(Map Themes) in the alternative language.
fields.tooltip: Same Map Themes configured above but in your alternative language.
fields.placeholder: e.g. Forest Atlas of Cameroon;Forest Atlas of Equatorial Guinea

fields.label: Title for the menu of your webmap
fields.tooltip: Menu title configured in your alternative language.

fields.label: Enter a narrative about your map to give your users some insight about it.
fields.tooltip: This will be visible in the table of contents.
fields.placeholder: Explore the Forest Atlas of Cameroon to discover ...

fields.tooltip: This adds a documents tab to the main tab panel in the app
fields.label: Would you like include an the documents tab

fields.tooltip: The url to the root directory to where the documents are stored
fields.label: Enter the url to the directory where documents are stored

fields.tooltip: This service will use the filename + the directory from above to link the documents
fields.label: Enter the url to the Map Service that contains filenames relative to the document directory(above)
ISO Code for your mask layer
fields.tooltip: Please enter the 3-digit ISO code of your country atlas

Title for the menu of your webmap
fields.tooltip: Menu title configured in your main language.
This will include restoration analysis in your app with all the below configured options.
fields.label: Include the Restoration analysis module in your application

fields.tooltip: Please see the Github Wiki on how to configure this service.
fields.label: Enter a url for the properly configured Image Server

fields.tooltip: This should be configured as Raster #5 in the above Image Server
fields.label: Enter a semi-colon separated list of the slope restoration options (Raster $5) in the order of the values in the data
fields.placeholder: e.g. Potential for ...;Two Restoration options ...;Three or more ...

fields.tooltip: This should be configured as Raster #5 in the above Image Server
fields.label: Same slope restoration options (Raster $5) as directly above but for an additional language if configured
fields.placeholder: e.g. Potential for ...;Two Restoration options ...;Three or more ...

fields.tooltip: This should have the same number of entries as above
fields.label: Enter a semi-colon separated list of the colors (RGB Format) you want to represent your above Slope Restoration Options

fields.tooltip: These show up under Restoration potential for ...
fields.label: Enter a semi-colon separated list of restoration analysis options.
fields.placeholder: establishing natural forest;restocking degraded natural forest;agri-silviculture...

fields.tooltip: These show up under Restoration potential for ...
fields.label: Enter the same restoration analysis options as directly above but for an additional language if configured.
fields.placeholder: establishing natural forest;restocking degraded natural forest;agri-silviculture...

fields.tooltip: These ID's must be in the exact same order as the restoration analysis options above
fields.label: Enter a semi-colon separated list of restoration analysis raster ids in the same order as the options above.

values.title: GFW Mapbuilder
values.subtitle: Make maps that matter
values.narrative: Explore the this map to discover ...
values.slopePotentialOptions: Potential for commercial plantation on bare soil and shrubland only;Potential for agri-silviculture and agro-silvo-pastoralism, and woodlot;Potential for establishing natural forest only;Potential for restocking degraded natural forest only;Potential for woodlot only;Potential for silvo-pastoralism only;Potential for tree-buffer zone along rivers, lakes and reservoirs only;Potential for commercial plantation as buffer zone around (NF)PAs;Two restoration options identified as having potential;Three or more restoration options identified as having potential
values.restorationOptions: establishing natural forest outside of cropland;restocking of degraded natural forest;agri-silviculture and agro-silvo-pastoralism;silvo-pastoralism;woodlot;commercial plantation on bare soil and shrubland;commercial plantation as buffer zone to national forest priority areas and protected areas;tree-based buffer zone along rivers, lakes and reservoirs;
